page.title: 02St.Peters Church,Titchfield
page.content: The church was built in the year 680 by the Saxons.The church takes every Christian on any day.It has had bits added on to it over the years and is now quite big.Forty-two vicars have worked here since 1302.The oldest part of the church is the nave and the most modern part of the church is the choir vestry.There are seven bells in the church and about thirty-four stained glass windows.Tom Pemberton has been a vicar for nineteen years and has worked at Titchfield church for twelve years.No-one is buried here in coffins any more but people still have their ashes spread in a little part of the graveyard by the river.The vicar's wages are paid by members of the church.The church is in Church Street and the vicar lives next to it.St. Peter's is a Church Of England church.
